rev.comment: The traditional realistic definition, without political edit.
Cleanup/[[WP:AWB/T|typo fixing]], typos fixed: becuase → because, extra-marital → extramarital, idealogy → ideology, was was → was using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
removed aggressive deletions of stockpuppet of banned user
bk to consensus version. removing ridiculous sections such as KKK (nothing to do with fascism) and Saddam's SOCIALIST party, this isnt fascist (eopithet) article
Stating opposition is superfluous. Opposition to liberalism entails opposition to democracy. Include opposition to conservatism.
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
this is a polemical paragraph which does not belong in the introduction any more than the Marxist view that fascism is a system designed to save capitalism in times of crisis
/* Positions on religion */ I took that polish-catholic part out, because it creates a misunderstanding. Poles were killed for being non-German, not for their religion. Same for 20 million orthodox?
/* Positions on religion */ Correct spelling: Weltanschauung
Slight reword to more accurately reflect sources - willing to make alliances with "other" groups, not "any" groups

Included fascist negations as usually formulated. State this is the view of "many" scholars - accounts for dissent. Include opp. to ''democratic'' socialism & common qualification of anti-conservatism
Date audit, [[User:Lightmouse/monobook.js/script.js|script]]-assisted; see [[Wikipedia:MOSNUM#Date_autoformatting|mosnum]] | Delink common terms. See: [[wp:overlink]]
your POV, you have not addressed R-41, if we can put it as being against conservatism them why not socialism? We already have a sentence below saying it opposed form of conservatism
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/208.102.103.71|208.102.103.71]] to last version by D ([[WP:HG|HG]])
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/208.102.103.71|208.102.103.71]] ([[User talk:208.102.103.71|talk]]) to last version by Mamalujo
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 236094350 by [[Special:Contributions/207.118.235.215|207.118.235.215]] ([[User talk:207.118.235.215|talk]]) Most sources that address the issue take this formulation.
the lede should fucus on the negates that most schilars argee (classical liberalism and communism) in addition no one has bothered to enage R-41 in conversion on the talk page and address his points
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 236016946 by [[Special:Contributions/207.118.235.215|207.118.235.215]] ([[User talk:207.118.235.215|talk]]) Says "many scholars". That accounts for some who disagree.
it was not against all forms of it as Griffin clarifies, and this article even cites sources that say that Italian Fascism had elements that were both revolutionary and traditionalist
I think denial of fascist opposition to conservatism is a minority view. The fascist negations are always stated as these three. I'll easily give a dozen cites. Still, I've edited to say "many".
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
it's still debate and not simply a minority view
if we can compare Baath to fascism then there should be a section on the KKK and fascism
Changed sentance re fascist negations to more accurate "Most scholars see Fascism as opposing [[liberalism]], [[conservatism]] and [[communism]]." This accounts for the dissenting minority.
totalitarianism is more precise than authoritarianism
/* Falangism */ tweaks. Can't use absolute here, not even supported by quotation whis says not "core".
/* Political spectrum */ changed "socialist/state nationalism" to "statist nationalism"
/* References */ Add: == See also == * [[Authoritarian complex]] * [[Delusions of grandeur]] * [[New world order]] * [[Totalitarianism]]
this is the best I can do, I'll leave someone more knowledgeable on subject to expand more
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 234875711 by [[Special:Contributions/Bobisbob|Bobisbob]] ([[User talk:Bobisbob|talk]]) Not only compelled or prohibited - voluntary in some cases per sources.
only fair to put this in if we have to put the fact that opposition to abortion was not based on the preservation of life.
As I said before, Griffin specifies the type of conservativism fascism was against, he doesn't not say it was aganist all forms of it, as I note about his writings on Fascism and mordernism
Restoring fascist negatives again. It opposes liberalism, conservatism and communism. Even Griffin, who editor uses as a basis to remove cons., says fascism opposes conservatism.
/* Para-fascism */Delete unsourced comment that para-fascism is a neologism. Term is almost as old as fascism itself. I've found it in works as early as the 1930s.
/* Social policies */ Delete unsourced POV editorializing
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/68.192.68.96|68.192.68.96]] ([[User talk:68.192.68.96|talk]]) to last version by William Avery
Disambiguate [[French Empire]] to [[French colonial empire]] using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 234371334 by [[Special:Contributions/R-41|R-41]] ([[User talk:R-41|talk]]) It is not obvious that neo-Nazis favor and promote certain abortions.
/* Social policies */ No need for this quote, it is obvious that neo-Nazis adopt the key racial policies of the Nazi regime
/* Social policies */ The "Battle for Births" was declared one year after abortion and birth control were declared illegal
/* Social policies */ Removed inaccurate reference, not all fascist movements believed in racial hygene and eugenics
rv. unreferenced and wrong according to many scholars and common sense
Fascism is also opposed to Socialism.
/* Social policies */ reinserted sourced material deleted w/o any justification
/* Social policies */ source says "social policy" not "certian social policies". Additional info from source distinguishing radical and conservative right from fascists on social policy.

Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/152.106.240.12|152.106.240.12]] to version by 69.29.241.42. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|Report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot]]. (469948) (Bot)
/* Social policies */ Whether one can speak of "fascist social policy", political nature of those policies, cites.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 233732797 by [[Special:Contributions/R-41|R-41]] ([[User talk:R-41|talk]]) Point implicitly made above tha fascists are anti-abortion. This fact counters and balances that
/* Social policies */ No need for this quote, it is obvious that neo-Nazis adopt the key racial policies of the Nazi regime
/* Social policies */ The reference from Bartleby said NOTHING about anti-conservatism about fascism and was just a short summary of fascism
/* Falangism */ removed unsourced adjective--no support for "far-left" in source cited
/* Social policies */ Alright I will review all judgements of what the political direction of the policies were, but the actual policies should remain
/* Social policies */ Remove unsourced, OR and personal opinion about what is conservative and progressive. i.e. hostility to the church is "progressive"?
/* Italian Fascism */ deleted footnote that didn't work
Redid section that was deleted by another user, have put in more information that I did not mention earlier that may have made the article appear biased.
/* Social policies */ section is completely POV drivel
/* Social policies */Added NPOV and OR tags to ocial Policies section
/* Falangism */ info on post fascist Falange not relevent to this article
/* Rexism */ disassociated with the Church as it became more radical
Fascism's opposition to conservatism is disputed by a number of major scholars such as Robert Paxton
reverted back info deleted by sockpuppet
Restoring a sourced section which I added which was removed by another user
reverted back summaried form, we already have these details in the Itailian fascist article. why is it so important to have the whole article here?
disputable by whom? these are sourced by reputable sources. Few doubt the existance of neo-fascism.
Again corrected the structure of the lead. This article is about an ideology, not "a term".
/* Political spectrum */ fascism existed post-WW2? disputable. no such movement ever came to power in any case.
dubious intro not backed up by sources
/* Political spectrum */ tosh huge paragraph focusing on national socialism, also has little to do with political spectrum
fascism can, in theory, exist without those I have removed just as communism, in theory, can exist without them also
Date the maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Elements of social conservatism */ this should get a brief meantion in Political spectrum section, it is given undue weight here
we could also add elements of socialism and capitalism, and who knows what else....

/* Debate of whether fascism is a reactionary political movement */
/* Debate of whether fascism is a reactionary political movement */
/* Debate of whether fascism is a reactionary political movement */
/* Debate of whether fascism is a reactionary political movement */
Reverting a deletion by an anonymous user who removed, fascism in power has demonstrated many social conservative beliefs, such as support of patriarchial society and opposition to social liberalism
Removing "Duce-02.jpg", it has been deleted from Commons by [[commons:User:Christian Nurtsch|Christian Nurtsch]] because: Missing essential information: source, license and/or permission.
/* Positions on religion */ Killing of thousands of priests in concentration camps, 3 million Catholic Poles killed, cite.

/* Positions on religion */ Source does not say there is a strong connection betwen some versions of fascism and religion, particularly the Cath. Church. Just notes connection to Brazil's integralism.
/* Positions on religion */ really fixed cite this time
/* Positions on religion */ add missing cite
/* Positions on religion */ Salgado's Integralism distinguished from European fascism
Fascism did not oppose socialism per se, but did oppose international socialism. See Griffin's "Fascism" section on "A new kind of Socialism" begining p. 126.

Date the maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Positions on religion */ delete controversial but unsourced assertion
Social conservatism. This misrepresents the sources. Even if the sources were saying this, it is a [[wp:fringe|fringe view]] contrary to most scholarship. Phrase "fascist negatives" as sources do.

summaried section, took text from Mossulini article
No page cite is provided for this factual assertion. Please provide page cite so fact can be verified.
they claimed to be revolutionary, I don't know about progressive

The source Anatomy of Fascism supports the statement, deleting it is unjustified. Read the sourced material on text page. It is not some conclusion that was reached because fascism was anti-liberal.
Rv to older stable intro. Take assertion that fascism is traditionalist to talk page. This is contrary to most reliable authority and would qualify as a [[WP:fringe|fringe]] view.

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 229830385 by [[Special:Contributions/Qualcuno75|Qualcuno75]] ([[User talk:Qualcuno75|talk]]) Anti-liberalism doesn't negate fascism's anti-conservatism. Take it to talk page
/* Para-fascism */Para-fascism is not a neologism at all. In fact it was coined almoste immediately after the term fascism, itself.
position of fascism in regards to conservatism, sourced (see talk page for text of sorced material)
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 229718794 by [[Special:Contributions/Qualcuno75|Qualcuno75]] ([[User talk:Qualcuno75|talk]]) Well documented - opposition to liberalism, communism AND conservatism.
removed disputed characteristic, I tried presenting both sides, but you can't have this if what is generally accepted is the opposite.

sentence simplification, clarification, factor out and presenting both sides
The article is about a topic, not about a "term". Also corrected grammar/punctuation

Simple formatting: seperated links "conservatism" and "militarism" with ", "
/* Positions on religion */ copyedit sentence on [[Iron Guard]] and link that article
communism article doesn't have a section on anti-fascism, so I'm not sure that fascism needs one on anti-communism. a summary in the "definition" section covers this topic adaquetly
/* Fascism, sexuality, and gender roles */ this whole section on "gender roles" looks more like an essay rather than something essentially relevent to the article
Core tenets section; though this needs a lot of work
bobisbob tried to cover up the presenation of fascism in government again. god knows why.
authoritarianism in place of totalitariamism. Totalitarian is not covered in references and is very POV.
begining to standardise all the article references into proper style.
Again it's all already in the Italian fascist article. We don't need an overload of text on a certain subject when it has it's own article. I don't know why you keep ignoring that.
/* Neo-fascism */ remove national socialism specific link when section is about neo-fascism.
missed the rise to power sub header
undo bobisbob, do not randomly cut out 2/3rds of what many argue is the only true fascism. full represenation.
/* Fascism and Religion */ expanding and reorganizing
I removed it because it's all already in the Italian fascist article. We don't need an overload of text on a certain subject when it has it's own article.
Parafascism not a varient of subform but a psuedofascism which resembles or apes it. Austro is semi or para. These facts are sourced. If you want to alter it, cite authority.
rv unsourced changes to the lead
Fascism does not always advocate republicanism, from 1922 to 1943, Mussolini served as Prime Minister in a monarchy, as well as Ion Antonescu of Romania, and Ante Pavelic of Croatia until 1943
[[User:Mboverload/AWB|Late-night typo raid]], typos fixed: conquerers → conquerors using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
I think the lead should also link [[neo-fascism]], since we discuss the question of whether the term should be applied in the present
adjusted lead as per comment on talk page. The article is about the ideology, not about "a term".
/* Other variations and subforms */ Austofascism is a variation. early on Dolufuss especially was linked with Mussolini and both opposed early national socialism in favour of trad fascism.
/* Neo-fascism */ neo-fascism isn't a specific subform of fascism, its an ambigious term allies to numerous, very different movements, non in power
/* Political spectrum */ Walter Laqueur has an article, correct name spelling
/* Early Falangism */ link to Kataeb Party of Lebanon
I don't know why bobisbob removed a huge chunk of the most definative and original form of fascism. this needs full presenation
rm at least some degree of
corporatism is an integral and important part of fascism
link is included in template on the left
fixed "See also" text at top to appear more like a hatnote
